page.title: 14FARMS
page.content:
Farming is the industry of our area. Most of the farmers have been farming for life or became farmers some years ago when land was not as expensive as it is now. Farms vary in size from 28 to 372 acres.Livestock farming takes place in our area.Farmers rear cows, calves, bulls, sheep and some chickens and pigs.Most animals are sold for meat and those remaining are used for breeding.Crops such as silage, hay, barley, turnips and corn are all grown to feed the animals. The most popular make of tractor is Masey Ferguson but Ford,International, Case and J.Deere are also used. Very few farmers employ anyone, and if they do it is only usually casual labour needed for harvesting crops.
{by James Chouffot.
